decks.notes: This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes key artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key for potential combo finishes. With a strong suite of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, along with disruption like Swords to Plowshares and Seal of Cleansing, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing control on the board. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and flexibility to the deck.

This deck focuses on using Hatebear creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure through aggressive creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's spells. The inclusion of disruption and acceleration cards like Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox allows the deck to establish early board presence and control the game. With a mix of disruptive creatures and hate cards, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's gameplay with hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also includes cards like Cavern of Souls and Karakas to protect its own creatures. Additionally, it runs cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to control the game with disruptive creatures and lock the opponent out of the game while steadily building up a board presence to secure victory.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Paradoxical Outcome deck revolves around using artifacts, spells, and card draw to generate mana and draw cards, leading to a big turn with powerful plays such as Paradoxical Outcome to capitalize on the artifacts on the board. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion to provide additional recursion and value. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base includes key lands like Tolarian Academy and various Moxen for acceleration.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo with cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Doomsday itself. Thassa's Oracle is used as the win condition once the Doomsday pile is set up. The deck also includes various counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo, as well as card draw and search spells to find the combo pieces efficiently. The deck is focused on setting up the combo as quickly as possible and disrupting opponents while doing so.

The deck focuses on using the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with creatures through cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Golgari Thug. It aims to bring back powerful threats like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam for recurring value. It also incorporates disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. The key strategy is to aggressively deploy threats from the graveyard while disrupting the opponent's game plan, overwhelming them with a fast and relentless combo.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using artifacts such as Mana Crypt, Grim Monolith, and Coveted Jewel, allowing for explosive plays. The key strategy involves using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand, drawing cards and generating even more mana in the process. This allows the player to unleash powerful spells like Tinker to search for game-winning threats such as The Mightstone and Weakstone or time-related win conditions like Karn, the Great Creator with the Time Vault combo. The deck focuses on efficiently utilizing artifacts to achieve a powerful and fast win condition.

The deck focuses on using the powerful combo of Underworld Breach and Lórien Revealed to generate a massive amount of card advantage and mana, allowing for explosive plays and fast wins. The inclusion of multiple cantrips, card draw spells, and free counterspells help to dig through the deck quickly and protect the combo pieces. The deck also utilizes mana rocks like Moxen and Sol Ring to accelerate its game plan and effectively disrupt the opponent. Additionally, the presence of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor further strengthen the deck's consistency and power level.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to set up a powerful combo using Paradoxical Outcome. The key strategy involves creating a loop with artifacts like The One Ring and Coveted Jewel to generate infinite mana, draw cards, and potentially win the game through card advantage and overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently combo off and win the game quickly with its powerful artifact synergy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plays while developing a strong board presence. It utilizes a mix of efficient threats and disruptive spells to control the game. Cards like Collector Ouphe shut down artifact-based strategies, while Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide a quick clock. The deck also has ways to deal with opposing threats with cards like Assassin's Trophy and Force of Will. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency and the ability to cast spells on curve. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through the use of powerful artifacts like Moxen and artifact lands, and then to utilize cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards and generate even more mana. The deck also includes key cards like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den to further enhance its combo potential. With the ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces and a variety of disruption options, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

This deck focuses on using efficient control spells and disruption to slow down the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through card draw and recursion. It leverages powerful Vintage staples such as Force of Will and Ancestral Recall to stay ahead in card advantage while utilizing powerful creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Snapcaster Mage to pressure the opponent. The deck also features disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base and powerful artifact synergies with Urza's Saga.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering spells, disrupting the opponent's strategy, and generating card advantage through card draw and manipulation. It utilizes a combination of efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, along with powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of cards like Demonic Tutor and Time Vault also provide additional ways to win the game. Overall, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining control over the board through counterspells and removal spells. It also utilizes card draw and manipulation to consistently find the necessary answers to threats. The presence of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Black Lotus allows for explosive plays and significant card advantage. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Collector Ouphe further hinders the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence of Merfolk creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and disruptive spells. The key strategy involves playing powerful Merfolk creatures like Hullbreacher and True-Name Nemesis alongside efficient mana acceleration cards like Moxen and Urza's Saga. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and protect its creatures with counterspells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

The deck focuses on a proactive strategy that aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent, while also using aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Solitude to quickly close out the game. By combining disruptive elements with a quick clock, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the game from the early stages. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration and land disruption to ensure a smooth and powerful gameplay.
